intro: Scorzonera lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a stout, fleshy root that is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Scorzonera lanuginosa is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
